title: Misleading error message when mistyped pattern matching in closure's argument

labels.name: A-diagnostics
labels.description: Area: Messages for errors, warnings, and lints

labels.name: A-parser
labels.description: Area: The parsing of Rust source code to an AST.

labels.name: T-compiler

body:
<!--
Thank you for filing a bug report! 🐛 Please provide a short summary of the bug,
along with any information you feel relevant to replicating the bug.

If you cannot produce a minimal reproduction case (something that would work in
isolation), please provide the steps or even link to a repository that causes
the problematic output to occur.
-->

Given the following code: ([playground](https://play.rust-lang.org/?version=stable&mode=debug&edition=2021&gist=aee5344af3e9eb717a5b02db6801707d))

```rust
fn main() {
    let _ =
        std::collections::HashMap::<String, i32>::new()
            .iter()
            .map(|(k, v | format!("{}->{}", k, v));
}
```

The current output is:

```
error: mismatched closing delimiter: `}`
 --> src/main.rs:5:17
  |
1 | fn main() {
  |           - closing delimiter possibly meant for this
...
5 |             .map(|(k, v | format!("{}->{}", k, v));
  |                 ^ unclosed delimiter
6 | }
  | ^ mismatched closing delimiter

error: expected one of `,` or `:`, found `;`
 --> src/main.rs:5:51
  |
5 |             .map(|(k, v | format!("{}->{}", k, v));
  |                                                   ^ expected one of `,` or `:`
```

<!-- The following is not always necessary. -->
Ideally the output should look like:

```
error: expected one of `)`, `,`, `@`, or `|`, found `=>`
 --> src/main.rs:5:24
5 |             .map(|(k, v | format!("{}->{}", k, v));
  |                   ^    -^
  |                   |    |
  |                   |    help: `)` may belong here
  |                   ^ unclosed delimiter
```

Almost like it currently does for a similar `match` mistype: ([playgroud](https://play.rust-lang.org/?version=stable&mode=debug&edition=2021&gist=f2beb488739f577a0cf62c6915e9eca5))

```rust
fn main() {
    match (1, 2) {
        (k, v => 0
    }
}
```

Although I'd prefer if it is a single error message, not two, like currently:

```
error: expected one of `)`, `,`, `@`, or `|`, found `=>`
 --> src/main.rs:3:9
  |
3 |         (k, v => 0
  |         ^    -^^
  |         |    |
  |         |    help: `)` may belong here
  |         unclosed delimiter

error: expected one of `,`, `.`, `?`, `}`, or an operator, found `)`
 --> src/main.rs:4:5
  |
3 |         (k, v => 0
  |               --  - expected one of `,`, `.`, `?`, `}`, or an operator
  |               |
  |               while parsing the `match` arm starting here
4 |     }
  |     ^ unexpected token
```
